p: A different strategy was followed in a recent work, in which quaternized chitosan samples with alkyl chains were prepared by an external acid-free method [ 39]. In this approach, a quaternary ammonium molecule containing carboxylic acid was synthesized, which acted as a reactant for attachment onto the amino groups of chitosan via 1-ethyl-3-(3-dimethylaminopropyl) carbodiimide/ N-hydroxysuccinimide (EDC/NHS) chemistry and also acted as an acid for the dissolution of chitosan. The antimicrobial activity was tested against planktonic Gram-positive Staphylococcus epidermidis and E. coli bacteria, and Candida albicans fungi, by evaluating the MIC and minimum bactericidal and fungicidal concentration (MBC and MFC, respectively) and against biofilms. Although the chitosan derivative showed growth inhibition and biocidal effects, the results against Gram-negative bacteria were modest.
